channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Patrick van der Wel
item.description: The latest results of our #huntingtonsdisease research program is now on #bioRxiv https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.07.21.549993v1. Title: Integrative determination of the atomic structure of mutant huntingtin exon 1 fibrils from Huntington's disease.It describes the structure of #amyloid fibrils formed by the mutant protein behind Huntington‚Äôs disease. We teamed up with the group of Markus Miettinen at the University of Bergen (prev. MPI colloids at Potsdam @maxplanckgesellschaft. #structuralbiology #biophysics

item.title: Ele Willoughby
item.description:
Happy birthday to #astronomer Vera Rubin (ne√© Cooper, ‚Äò28-‚Äò16) & her discovery that angular motion of galaxies deviates from predictions, 1st evidence for dark matter, now known as 5x as common as matter & the stuff which dictates dynamics of galaxies & evolution of our universe! Nobel committee waited 3 years after she died to reward another for the theory of dark matter. She found 6 months mat leave post MSc very difficult being
1/n#printmaking #sciart #linocut #womenInSTEM #MastoArt

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
Guest post by Huanzi Zhang on my blog covering the momentous year for Wiley's offshoot Hindawi, which seems determined to reboot its special issue program, despite the massive hit to income caused by paper mills
http://deevybee.blogspot.com/2023/07/is-hindawi-well-positioned-for.html
#Wiley #Hindawi #papermills #publishing #business #sleuths #PubPeer

item.title: Mina
item.description: @BorisBarbour You're right: It is great to be able to edit toots and that those, who boosted it, get alerted. I still wish, I had checked the numbers first.Despite all the bad blood, I am still quite happy that there is no indication that the overall statement (wind turbines are only a minor cause for killed birds, compared to others) was in any way wrong.

item.title: Konrad Kording
item.description: Can there be good Bayesian models of misinformation receptivity? https://econtent.hogrefe.com/doi/abs/10.1027/1016-9040/a000498?journalCode=epp

item.title: Teixi
item.description:
@manisha @Neurograce @neuroscience @cogsci @cogneurophys @PessoaBrain @cian comment in thread reminded me:@kordinglab recent talks on how #computationalneuroscience #ml methods, while spread across labs & papers, still face #neurotheory proven grounds:Does the #brain do #gradientDescent ?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E5hATeCZQnU#causality for #neuroscience & beyond
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XUD69JshQTk#philosophyofneuroscience
#systemsneuroscience
#mindbrainps: IMHO #ml yea: best when for discovery, not causality

item.title: mekka okereke :verified:
item.description: When you do your "Oppenheimer calculus," and are justifying the dropping of the bomb because it "saved more lives than it cost," remember to factor in the creation of the Congo crisis (100K dead in under 4 years), and the assassination of Patrice Lumumba.Where did the Uranium come from? And how did the US ensure that neither the Germans or the Russians would get any?(Answers: The Congo. By eliminating Lumumba)https://www.theguardian.com/world/2000/aug/10/martinkettlehttps://fnl.mit.edu/january-february-2021/the-legacy-of-the-involvement-of-the-democratic-republic-of-the-congo-in-the-bombs-dropped-on-hiroshima-and-nagasaki/

item.title: Teal
item.description: Coming to Mastodon from Twitter feels like busting in the door loudly brandishing a half drunk bottle of tequila and finding everyone sitting in horrified silence holding cups of tea and academic papers

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
A thread on guest post by Huanzi Zhang http://deevybee.blogspot.com/2023/07/is-hindawi-well-positioned-for.html
It digs into some of the financial aspects of @WileyGlobal‚Äôs acquisition of @Hindawi.
One draw for #Wiley was the low cost of #Hindawi‚Äôs lean fully open access operation
The acquisition looked like a good move, because of huge appetite in #China for open access publishing. Seemed like win-win, as Chinese researchers cld find a home for papers they needed for promotion etc, and Wiley could profit from the APCs.
1/n #publishing

item.title: Erik Moeller
item.description: With Twitter rebranding itself out of existence, millions of websites will have to update their "follow" and "share" buttons.A perfect opportunity to finally add Mastodon or Fediverse buttons.

item.title: James Heathers
item.description: I really hope my Actual Science People continue to use this platform and it can be walled off as a place to talk about The Really Hard Shit. Not all science communication has to be for everyone, and it would be nice to have a TEH VACINES DID IT free space that is also actually populated with people I'd talk to more than once.

item.title: Louis Ingenthron
item.description: @stevesilberman For that take to be true, Elon would have to have had clear goals beforehand and would have needed the necessary focus and dedication over the course of months to work towards those goals.That seems to be vastly overestimating his abilities.Occam's Razor says he bought a fun toy and the rest is just rich guy flailing.Attributing malice to his incompetence is a fool's errand.

item.title: the three-day monk
item.description:
Is this one of the mechanisms underlying ‚Äúenshittification‚Äù described by @pluralistic?‚ÄúThe point isn't that venture capitalists sometimes invest in companies that don't make their money back. The point is that the entire model deployed by VCs is to profit by disrupting the marketplace with predatory pricing, and leave the losses to the suckers who buy into the IPO.‚ÄùThe dirty little secret that could bring down Big Tech by Adam Rogers | Business Insider
https://www.businessinsider.com/venture-capital-big-tech-antitrust-predatory-pricing-uber-wework-bird-2023-7
